body:
Turns out the JVM does not require the generation of visibility bridge methods for default methods.

I already fixed this in Byte Buddy and its gonna be a part of the next release. If the interface is not package-private, the problem goes away.
Turns out, too that this is a bug and the JVM throws an illegal access error when invoking a default method of a package-private type via reflection.
This is fixed in the latest Byte Buddy release, we just need to update.

issue.title: With Inline Mocking enabled, Mockito throws when mocking interface with default method

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
Similar to issue https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/944

org.mockito.exceptions.base.MockitoException: 
Mockito cannot mock this class: interface xxx.XXX.MMM.SomeInterface.

If you're not sure why you're getting this error, please report to the mailing list.


Java               : 9
JVM vendor name    : Oracle Corporation
JVM vendor version : 9.0.4+11
JVM name           : Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM
JVM version        : 9.0.4+11
JVM info           : mixed mode
OS name            : Mac OS X
OS version         : 10.13.3


You are seeing this disclaimer because Mockito is configured to create inlined mocks.
You can learn about inline mocks and their limitations under item #39 of the Mockito class javadoc.
